modelIdentification.name: Intel_v1.0.1r2
modelIdentification.purpose: Define Intelligence-related objects used in JLVC
modelIdentification.description: Define Intelligence-related objects used in JLVC
modelIdentification.useHistory: v1.0.1r2 - add AbstractIntentinteraction, change EmittertypeEnum16 from HLAinteger16BE to UnsignedInteger16BE

v1.0.1r3 Release Notes - Change meta-data to match use in AFMSTT. Change update types from Periodic to Conditional/On change Subscribe to BasicEncyclopedia, ContactNet, and Contact objects. Mark all ContactTrack, Datum, and LineOfBearing attributes as P/S/D/A.
v1.0.1r5 - Remove Lat/Long DDM dimensions from all classes.

objectClass.name: BasicEncyclopedia
objectClass.semantics: Root class for all Basic Encyclopedia (BE) Installation, Facility, and Desired Mean Point of Impact (DMPI) objects.

attribute.name: FUN
attribute.semantics: Federation Unique Identifier

attribute.name: centerLocation
attribute.semantics: current location of object

attribute.name: countryCode
attribute.semantics: Two letter identifier of country controlling object

attribute.name: description
attribute.semantics: text description (usually 80 characters or less in the MIDB)

objectClass.name: BE_Facility
objectClass.semantics: An actual structure, and is part of an installation plus has a unique

attribute.name: BE_Number
attribute.semantics: BE number of the installation owning this facility - 10 characters

attribute.name: O_Suffix
attribute.semantics: 5 character identifier of this facility, unique within this BE number. Combination of BE number and OSuffix uniquely identifies every facility.

attribute.name: categoryCode
attribute.semantics: 5 digit number categorizing the facility by function and composition. They are grouped by series, i.e. 94xxx are all bridges. Thus the cat code will identify a \"concrete command headquaters, three floors, reincforced roof\""

attribute.name: structuralStatus
attribute.semantics: % damaged, 100 is completely undamaged, 0 is totally destroyed

objectClass.name: DMPI
objectClass.semantics: Desired Mean Point of Impact, an aim point at which the attacker wishes to place ordinace or in some cases the center of a sensor\'s field of view

attribute.name: BE_Facility
attribute.semantics: Federation Unique Name of the BE facility associated with this aim point

attribute.name: DMPI_ID
attribute.semantics: 12 character designation for this DMPI, comes from targeting database and should be unique

attribute.name: DMPI_Status
attribute.semantics: damage status of this DMPI, 100 is completely undestroyed, 0 is totally destroyed

objectClass.name: Contact
objectClass.semantics: Describes the attributes used to transmit individual contact messages through a multi-level communications hierarchy. Each node in the hierarhcy publishes its own version of the contact with information that has been fused from all its subordinates, superiors, and organic sensors. This class is separated from the definition of the ContactTrack class to support the eventual addition of mission data to the contact network.

attribute.name: Channel
attribute.semantics: Second dimension in the ContactHierarchy DDM sub-space. Channel 0 holds reports that are limited to this node\'s communication group. Channel 1 holds reports that must be shared with remote communication groups. Reports on channel 1 are also available on the local communication group. Required field.

attribute.name: ChatReport
attribute.semantics: This flag is used to control the release of contact reports to C&R chat rooms. Once set to true, the sending platform should toggle this value back to false on the next update.

attribute.name: CommGroup
attribute.semantics: First dimension in the ContactHierarchy DDM sub-space. Nodes in the same communications group are treated as a local area network for the purposes of DDM. The CommGroup/Channel combination (0,0) is reserved for the broadcast of ContactNet objects across the federation. CommGroup 1 is reserved for the C4IGW. Required field.

attribute.name: LastReporter
attribute.semantics: Reference to the ContactNet object owned by the entity that created the last report for this contact. When contact report is fused at the next (or previous) level in the communications hierarchy, this field is set equal to the owner of the original report. Infinite feedback loops are avoided by requiring platforms to ignore any reports for which the \"Last Reporter\" equals their own ContactNet ID. Required for all fused reports.

attribute.name: Owner
attribute.semantics: Reference to the ContactNet object owned by the entity that is updating this contact. Note that for JSAF platforms, this is not the Platform ID. For fused contacts, this is the ContactNet of the entity performing the fusion. Required field.

attribute.name: ReleaseReport
attribute.semantics: Defines the scope of distribution for this report. When this value is true, the report has been released for distribution to the platform\'s superiors. Once released, all future updates are sent to the superior until this value becomes false. Some platforms release their reports on creation (ex: sonobuoy) and others require operator intervention before the report is released (ex: DDG with live FOTC). Contact reports are always processed by this platform\'s subordinates, regardless of the value of this flag.

attribute.name: SerialNumber
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. Simple counter used by JSAF and C4IGW to troubleshoot potential packet loss.

objectClass.name: ContactTrack
objectClass.semantics: This class represents the perceived position and classification information for a single target. Individual contacts are represented by a \"Contact\" object for each level in the communications hierarchy. This is required to model the latency of the communications network. Changes to fields within this object are treated as operational messages between simulated entities on the virtual battlefield. The structure of this class is designed to support the information required to integrate with OTH-G CTC, OTH-G JUNIT, LINK 16 Track Messages, USMTF SENSOREP, USMTF ATI.ATR, and JVMF K02.9 Target Data messages. Aggregated units such as air wings, artillery batteries, and infantry platoons are reported as a single unit with component parts. The structure of this class is very flat to allow information to be added at it slowly becomes available through the fusion of sensor and intelligence data.

attribute.name: AlertLevel
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. Designates different levels of platform interest in this target.

attribute.name: BestSensor
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. Defines the sensor which produced the best position report for this contact. Equivalent to the code in Entry List 1104 of the OTH-G message specification.

attribute.name: BestSource
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. Defines the call sign of the platform that produced the best position report for this contact. Equivalent to the Command entry in the OTH-G MSGID specification.

attribute.name: DegreeOfProtection
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. An indicator of the vulnerability of personnel to attack. Equivalent to the Degree of Personnel Protection field in the USMTF TST specification.

attribute.name: DetectionTime
attribute.semantics: Simulation time for the most recent change in this information. Used to calculate how \"time late\" the information is at the receiver.

attribute.name: Domain
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. Domain of operations (Air, Land, Surface, Subsurface, etc.) for this contact. Equivalent to the Category field in the OTH-G CTC specification.

attribute.name: Echelon
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. Organization level of the reported unit. Equivalent to the Echelon field in the OTH-G JUNIT specification. Also equivalent to the Target Size field in the USMTF TGSI specification.

attribute.name: Emitters
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. A list containing info on the emitters that have been detected by esm and associated with this contact.

attribute.name: Flag
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. Country code for this contact\'s current allegiance. Equivalent to the Flag field in the OTH-G CTC and JUNIT specifications.

attribute.name: GccsLocalTrackNumber
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. The GCCS local track number (LTN) for this report. The first letter identifies the type of track (T=platform, L=link, E=elint). This is followed by a four digit numeric field, with leading zeros, that is sequentially assigned. This field is equivalent to the Track Number field the OTH-G CTC specification. In NTCE, this number is assigned by the first GCCS system to receive a report on this contact.

attribute.name: GccsUniqueId
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. OTH-G unique identifier for this contact. The first three letters identify the original reporter. This is followed by a nine digit numeric field, with leading zeros, that is sequentially assigned by this reporter. This field is equivalent to the Unique Identifier field the OTH-G CTC specification. In NCTE, this number is created by subordinates that have defined a valid GccsTriGraph field in their ContactNet. It is required because GCCS tracks need a means to be correlated with simulation tracks and GCCS has no knowledge the ground truth information needed to fill out the Target field.

attribute.name: HoldingStatus
attribute.semantics: This field indicates if the owner, or one of its subordinates, is maintaining a track on this contact. Most sensors allow some updates to be missed before the sensor\'s database marks the track as lost. This field is also used to communicate contact deletion across the federation. The list of status values are SelfReport, HeldSuperior, Held, Lost, and Deleted.

attribute.name: HullNumber
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. This field is only used for Maritime contacts. Defines the hull (pennant) number of the contact being reported. Enter the numbers and letters as they appear on the hull (e.g. 1070, D87, F169). Equivalent to the Pennant Number field in the OTG-G CTC specification.

attribute.name: IFF
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. The Interrogator Friend or Foe codes associated with this report. This code is a string delimited combination of NATO or SOVIET IFF codes in the form NATO/11/2222/3333/C/4 where 11 represents the two digit mode 1 country code, \"2222\" represents the four octal digits of the mode 2 PIF code, \"3333\" represents the four octal digits of the mode 2 Mission code, \"C\" is present if mode 3 support altitude reporting, and the \"4\" field has a value of \"1\" if secure mode 4 is supported or missing if it is not. All of the slashes are present regardless of whether the field holds data or not. Mission data is treated the same as zeros.

attribute.name: IdAccuracy
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. Reporter\'s confidence in the current classification on a scale of 0 to 100%. A value of 0% indicates no confidence while a value of 100% indicates perfect confidence. Defaults to zero confidence.

attribute.name: LinkTrackId
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. Tactical Data Link (Link-11 or Link-16) identifier for this contact. Link-11 track numbers are four digit octal values. Link-16 track numbers are 2 alphanumeric fields followed by four decimal digits. Equivalent to the System Track Number field in the OTG-G CTC specification.

attribute.name: Name
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. The military label used to designate this contact on C4I displays. Equivalent to the Name field in the OTG-G CTC and JUNIT specifications. If not provided, this field should be interpreted as \"UNKNOWN\" which has special meaning to GCCS. In NTCE, the C4I Gateway prepends an \"X\" to each track name (including unknowns) before sending it to GCCS. The \"X\" is removed from reports coming back from GCCS.

attribute.name: PreplannedMissionID
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. Reference to this object in the pre-planned fire missions. Equivalent to the Target Identifier in the USMTF TNO specification. This field can represent data from a variety of planning systems including BE Number (e.g. /1234DF8765), BE WITH SUFFIX (e.g. /S1234F1234599), BE WITH BEN SUFFIX (e.g. /N1234-12345AA001), PLSS (e.g. /X12345), PIN (e.g. /E12345001), ABCA (e.g. /AAA1234), Theater Target Number (e.g. /T1A12345AZ), HULTEC (e.g. /H1234ABCEF123), and FIBE (e.g. /2134AA1689).

attribute.name: RadioCallSign
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. International radio call sign of the contact being reported. (e.g. VV158993, W4GBP, BXAR). The IRCS is a communications identifier usually unique to a command or unit. Equivalent to the International Radio Call Sign in the OTG-G CTC and JUNIT specifications.

attribute.name: Service
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. Service equivalent to U.S. forces (such as Army, Navy, Marines, etc.). Equivalent to the Service field in the OTH-G JUNIT specification.

attribute.name: ShipControlNumber
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. This field is only used for Maritime contacts. Defines the ONI ship control number for this contact. Equivalent to the SCONUM field in the OTG-G CTC specification.

attribute.name: SignalNoiseRatio
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. Signal to noise ratio for the sensor which produced the best position report for this contact. Used as a tie-breaker between sensors with the same Track Quality.

attribute.name: Target
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. Reference to the ground truth information for this contact. This field is used by constructive entities to perform data fusion across multiple sources. This is a required field for everything except orphan tracks, that is, tracks that have no JSAF equivalent, coming into the simulation from GCCS. Reports coming from GCCS are required to support the GccsUniqueId field as an alternate form of track correlation.

attribute.name: ThreatType
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. Threat posture of the target (Friendly, Hostile, etc.) as perceived by the reporting station. Equivalent to the Target or Friendly Unit Subtype USMTF TST specification.

attribute.name: TrackQuality
attribute.semantics: Reliability of the horizontal position estimate on a scale of 0-15 (altitude errors are not taken into account). The LINK-16 system specifies the relationship between each Track Quality value and the maximum area of uncertainty associated with that value. A value of zero is reserved for non-real time tracks. Platforms that only support LINK-11 (such as FFG and DD ships) are limited to Track Qualities less than or equal to 7. The Track Quality is used to determine the platform and sensor which holds Reporting Responsibility (RR) for each track. A sensor may take over RR for a track if its local TQ exceeds the current TQ by two (2) or more. On Link-11, there is an exception where TQ7 tracks are allowed to take over RR from TQ6 tracks.

attribute.name: TrackType
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. This field represents the perceived platform classification for this contact. For aggregate units, it is the platform classification of the highest value target in the unit (e.g. SA-6 Battery). Because the data type supports multiple levels of classification, perception can get more and more detailed as time progresses (e.g. a Russian Surface Combatant transitions to a Russian DDG then to a Sovremenny class and finally to the Boyevoy (DDG-6)). This identification supports both the Class-Name and Type fields in the OTG-G CTC specification. It also supports the Platform field in the OTG-G JUNIT specification. It is also equivalent to the Target Type and Target Subtypes fields in the USMTF TST and JVMF K02.9 specifications. If not provided, this field should be interpreted as \"UNEQUATED\" which has special meaning to GCCS.

attribute.name: Trademark
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. This field is only used for Maritime contacts. Defines the ship trademark for this contact. Equivalent to the Trademark field in the OTG-G CTC specification.

attribute.name: UnitElements
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. List of the types and number of entities observed in this unit. For example, an M198 battery consists of 6 towed artillery howitzers, several people, and a variety of support vehicles.

objectClass.name: Datum
objectClass.semantics: Latitude/Longitude version of a target location. Typically used by sensors that can measure both bearing and range such as radars, active sonars, and visual systems.

attribute.name: Altitude
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. Altitude component of the target position.

attribute.name: AouMajor
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. Length of the major axis for an elliptic area of uncertainty.

attribute.name: AouMinor
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. Length of the minor axis for an elliptic area of uncertainty.

attribute.name: AouOrient
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. Orientation of the major axis for an elliptic area of uncertainty. Note that the major axis can be shorter than the minor axis. But the major axis is always the one at this orientation.

attribute.name: Course
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. Direction of advance for this target.

attribute.name: Latitude
attribute.semantics: Latitude component of the target position.

attribute.name: Longitude
attribute.semantics: Longitude component of the target position.

attribute.name: Speed
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. Speed of advance for this target.

attribute.name: Range
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. Distance along the surface of the earth from the sensor to the target, at the time of detection.

attribute.name: Bearing
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. True bearing of the target relative to the sensor position, at the time of detection.

objectClass.name: LineOfBearing
objectClass.semantics: Sensor bearing version of a target location. Typically used by passive sensors such as ESM, passive sonars, and acoustic intercept.

attribute.name: Bearing
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. True bearing of the target relative to the sensor position.

attribute.name: BearingAmbig
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. If the sensor suffers from port/starboard ambiguity (e.g. passive sonar towed array), this field is used to define the true bearing of the ambiguous direction.

attribute.name: BearingError
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. Uncertainty estimate for the \"bearing\" field (degrees). Defines one dimension of the area of uncertainty for a line of bearing.")

attribute.name: Range
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. Distance along the surface of the earth from the sensor to the target.

attribute.name: RangeError
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. Uncertainty estimate for the \"range\" field. Defines the second dimension of the area of uncertainty for a line of bearing

attribute.name: SensorLatitude
attribute.semantics: Latitude component of the sensor position.

attribute.name: SensorLongitude
attribute.semantics: Longitude component of the sensor position.

objectClass.name: ContactNet
objectClass.semantics: This object defines the communication parameters for a network connection between a subordinate and its superior. The information for the connection is published by the subordinate. These parameters are published across the HLA network and subscribed to by the superior. The model assumes that communications effects are modeled at the receiver so that a single transmission can have different effects on different receivers.

attribute.name: CommGroup
attribute.semantics: First dimension in the ContactHierarchy DDM sub-space. Nodes in the same communications group are treated as a local area network for the purposes of DDM. The CommGroup/Channel combination (0,0) is reserved for the broadcast of ContactNet objects across the federation. CommGroup/Channel combination (0,1) is reserved for the C4IGW. Required field.

attribute.name: GccsTriGraph
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. Three letter abbreviation used to identify the subordinate platform to the GCCS network. Only required for platforms that report directly to C4IGW/GCCS. If defined, it is used by the platform to create a unique GccsUniqueId for each contact that it owns.

attribute.name: IsDisabled
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. Indication from the subordinate platform that line-of-sight requirements are not currently met. The subordinate platform is responsible for checking line-of-sight requirements on a periodic basis. When a network connection is re-enabled, the receiving unit should update itself with the last reported state of each contact. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: Latency
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. Average point-to-point latency across this network connection. Latency is modeled at the receiver so that a single update can arrive at different times when sent to multiple receivers. Defaults to zero latency.

attribute.name: LatencyVariation
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. Variation in the point-to-point latency across this network connection. Latency is modeled at the receiver so that a single update can arrive at different times when sent to multiple receivers. Defaults to zero variation.

attribute.name: LineOfSight
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. Defines the line of sight requirements for this network connection. When this value is set to Required, the receiver ignores the update if there is no line of sight at the time of transmission (e.g. sonobuoy communications with aircraft). When this value is set to Submerged, the receiver ignores the update if the subordinate is submerged, but otherwise does not require line-of-sight (e.g. satellite communications with submarines).

attribute.name: Marking
attribute.semantics: Call sign of the subordinate entity for this network connection. This field is used to support the lookup of superiors by name without requiring the discovery of each connection\'s subordinate platform.

attribute.name: Owner
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. Reference to the simulated platform that published this network connection, i.e. the subordinate in the subordinate/superior relationship. If this network connection was published by a JSAF platform, then this is the Platform object ID. If this network connection was published by an abstract participant that does not produce a simulated entity (such as C4IGW), then this is NULL.

attribute.name: Reliability
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. Percentage of messages received by this network connection. Dropped messages are modeled at the receiver so that a single update can be sent to multiple unreliable receivers (some get the message and some do not). A value of 100% ensures that no messages are dropped. A value of 0% causes all messages to be lost. Defaults to a value of 100% if no value provided.

attribute.name: SerialNumber
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. Simple counter used by JSAF and C4IGW to troubleshoot potential packet loss.

attribute.name: Superior
attribute.semantics: OPTIONAL. Reference to the superior platform for this network connection. Instead of referring directly to the superior\'s platform, this field refers to the ContactNet object published by the superior. This allows the connection to be established with the superior even when the superior\'s platform has been excluded by DDM rules.

interactionClass.name: AbstractIntent
interactionClass.semantics: This interaction is proposed to convey simulation truth or inteded observation of an event that could be used by intel federates. Specifically, this event ties radio emissions to exercise storylines.

parameter.name: Sender
parameter.semantics: RTI Name of the sender of the action or intent

parameter.name: SenderEvent
parameter.semantics: Event ID of the transaction from the sender

parameter.name: Receiver
parameter.semantics: RTI Name of the receiver or target of the action or intent

parameter.name: receiverEvent
parameter.semantics: Event ID of the transaction from the receiver side

parameter.name: IntentType
parameter.semantics: Type of abstract intent generated by the simulation

parameter.name: eventTag
parameter.semantics: Exercise specific TAG or event key. ie. CrowdAction12

parameter.name: Misc
parameter.semantics: Placeholder for additional datagrams. This interaction is expected to evolve

parameter.name: ExchangeStyle
parameter.semantics: Optional. Information exchange style or method.

simpleData.name: Degrees_Latitude64
simpleData.semantics: decimal degrees, north or south of the equator

simpleData.name: Degrees_Longitude64
simpleData.semantics: decimal degrees, east or west of the universal Prime Meridian

simpleData.name: dB_Float64
simpleData.semantics: a logarithmic unit that indicates the ratio of a physical quantity (usually power or intensity) relative to a specified or implied reference level.

enumeratedData.name: LineOfSightEnum8
enumeratedData.semantics: Defines the line of sight requirements.

arrayData.name: RTIObjectIdStruct
arrayData.semantics: A unique RTI identifier specified by the federate when registering the object. It must not exceed 96 bytes. The format for the ID, coded as a string, is: <application name>/<IP address in hex>/<locally unique id>. See the JLVC Federation Integration Guide for specifics.

note.label: COPY-COPY-VOMT_AUTOGEN_DATATYPE
note.semantics: Automatically generated data type from an HLA 1.3 OMT file, please verify

note.label: COPY-COPY-jntc_55
note.semantics: Equivalent to JSAF SOM type of the same name.
